name: Balanced prime
summary:
In number theory, a balanced prime is a prime number with equal-sized prime gaps above and below it, so that it is equal to the arithmetic mean of the nearest primes above and below. Or to put it algebraically, the 
  
    
      
        n
      
    
    {\displaystyle n}
  
th prime number 
  
    
      
        
          p
          
            n
          
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle p_{n}}
  
 is a balanced prime if
